post_title: ATM took my card, what to do?

comments.author: Sufficient-Entry-488
comments.body:
I am pretty sure they won't give it back, but do call.

I had to create a new card when my bank's own ATM took it. It was a long time ago though.

comments.author: graamatvede
comments.body:
call your bank asap and block the card.
edit: banks usually have an emergency phone number for card blocking.

comments.author: _TheWildCat
comments.body: You can order a new card from your bank. You cannot get the one you left there back. Source: left my card in an atm.

comments.author: IndyDino
comments.body: There's little to no chance of getting it back but if you have added it to your Google wallet/Apple pay or your banking app supports it, you should be able to pay everywhere by tapping your phone. 99% of places accept card payments and don't require physical cash.

comments.author: RelativityJinx
comments.body: speaking from experience - they will not give it back, there is zero chance of that happening, so you need to order a new card from your bank.

comments.author: No-Cryptographer8074
comments.body: Yes I was able to do that already from my mobile app. :)

comments.author: No-Cryptographer8074
comments.body: Oh okay. I was hoping I could maybe get it back, it is from another country so it is not possible for me to get it right now but will have to wait then. :)

comments.author: izii_
comments.body: You can't get a card back unless it's the ATM  of your bank.

comments.author: No-Cryptographer8074
comments.body: Thank you for the info! Now I can start to figure out my next steps :) thanks to all!
